app.name: Gunshi
app.one_liner: Gunshi is a modern JavaScript command-line library for building declarative, type-safe, and composable CLI applications.

core_loop: Define commands declaratively with type-safe argument parsing, then execute them via a universal runtime API that supports Node.js, Deno, and Bun.

screens.name: Command Runner
screens.purpose: Execute configured CLI commands with parsed arguments and context.

rust_commands.name: run_command
rust_commands.purpose: Execute a declaratively defined CLI command with provided arguments and context.

mvp_plan: week 1: Implement argument parsing with args-tokens
acceptance_tests: CLI runs a simple greeting command with name, greeting, and repeat count arguments.
Nested sub-commands are correctly parsed and executed.
open_questions: How to best integrate internationalization into command definitions?
What plugin lifecycle hooks are essential for extensibility?
